services.name: Java Online
services.description:
Learn to program in Java, one of the most important languages for commercial software development, and the language used in AP Computer Science. Many students explore our extensive curriculum and stay with our program through 12th grade.

  • Classes meet one day per week for 1.5 hours
  • Tuition is $280/month
  • Student–teacher ratio of 5:1
  • Taught by experienced programmers
  • Grades 5-12 only

    • Our weekly classes run every week throughout the year, so when you register, we will enroll you at the same class time every week (bulk enrollment). You can then cancel or reschedule individual classes online through the client portal.


    To register for weekly classes

    • Review the schedule below for a day and time slot. ( It's best to select the "Month" view. )
    • Create a client account , and add your students to the account
    • Enroll in a first class for the day and time you want, from the list of classes below.
    • To enroll in all classes of the same day and time, every week, you can:
      • Email Liz Groves at info@jointheleague.org ( Click to compose an email ) with the day and time you would like.
      • Call us at (858) 284-0481.
      • Your child's instructor can enroll your child at the beginning of class.
    For all details on enrollment, please see our Enrollment Guide and our Policies and Procedures.
services.instructions:
Canceling a Class:

  1. Sign in to the Parent Portal: https://jtl.pike13.com/accounts/sign_in
  2. Under Upcoming, click the name of the appointment you wish to cancel your registration for.
  3. Click Cancel Registration, and then choose OK.

Scheduling a Make-Up:

  1. Sign in to the Parent Portal: https://jtl.pike13.com/accounts/sign_in
  2. Select the MAKE-UP LAB tab and use the calendar to find the date of the lab you would like to sign up for.
  3. Click on it and hit the Enroll button.
  4. Select the student you would like to enroll and hit the Finish button.
Make-Up Lab Info: current lab schedule is on-line

Discord:
Questions? Comments? Want to hang out?
Join The League on Discord:
https://discord.gg/tX764zp

services.name: Python Online
services.description:
Learn how to use python, one of the hottest programming languages used today. Python is used in everything from machine learning to data science. Our online Python Classes are for kids & teens who are eager to learn programming. We work closely with all students to make coding fun and engaging. Many students explore our extensive curriculum and stay with our program through 12th grade.


  • Classes meet one day per week for 1.5 hours
  • Tuition is $280/month
  • Student–teacher ratio of 5:1
  • Taught by experienced programmers

      • Call us at (858) 284-0481.
      • Your child's instructor can enroll your child at the beginning of class.
    For all details on enrollment, please see our Enrollment Guide and our Policies and Procedures.

services.name: Intro to Robotics ( Robot Riot )
services.description:
Build & Code: Micro:Bit Robotics

Take your coding skills to the next level by building and programming your own robot! In this exciting hands-on camp, students will use the Micro:Bit microcontroller to bring their creations to life. You'll learn how to program sensors, motors, and LEDs using Python, JavaScript, or block-based coding. Work with friends to design, build, and code robots that can move, interact, and respond to their environment. This camp is perfect for young engineers and programmers who want to explore the world of robotics in a fun and interactive way!

All equipment will be provided by The League of AMAZING Programmers. If you would like to keep your robot at the end of the course there will be an additional fee of $55.00 for the starter kit. As we progress through the course there may be optional add ons to the robot that can be purchased through amazon, those are optional and will be communicated if/when your child gets to that point.

services.name: AI Agents
services.description:
AI Agents: License to Code

Weekly Ongoing Class – Grades 5–12


 Build games, apps, and awesome projects with the help of AI!

In this fun, hands-on class, you’ll team up with AI coding agents to bring your ideas to life. You’ll create projects—like interactive games and web apps—while learning real coding skills along the way.

How it Works:

  • Start Anytime: Jump in at any point

  • Learn by Doing: Tell the AI what you want to build, guide it as it writes code, and learn how to make it your own.

  • Keep Leveling Up: Projects get more exciting and skills keep growing each week.

It’s like having a pro coder as your sidekick—so you can focus on creativity, problem-solving, and having fun while learning real-world coding skills.

  • Classes meet one day per week for 1.5 hours
  • Tuition is $280/month
Our weekly classes run every week throughout the year, so when you register, we will enroll you at the same class time every week (bulk enrollment). You can then cancel or reschedule individual classes online through the client portal.


To register for weekly classes
  • Review the schedule below for a day and time slot. ( It's best to select the "Month" view. )
  • Create a client account , and add your students to the account
  • Enroll in a first class for the day and time you want, from the list of classes below.
  • To enroll in all classes of the same day and time, every week, you can:
    • Email Liz Groves at info@jointheleague.org ( Click to compose an email ) with the day and time you would like.
    • Call us at (858) 284-0481.
    • Your child's instructor can enroll your child at the beginning of class.
For all details on enrollment, please see our Enrollment Guide and our Policies and Procedures.
services.description_short: Weekly AI class taught in person at our Carmel Valley classroom.
services.instructions:
Welcome...before your first day of class, we have some HOMEWORK for you!

  • Please have your student set up an account on GitHub. This is a TWO STEP PROCESS. First, on the GitHub site create a username and password which can be easily remembered by student. This account will be used to save class work on the first day (and each day thereafter). Second, after the account is created, GitHub will send you a verification email. You will need to open this email and follow the instructions for account verification. GitHub is a site which stores their code in the cloud so students can access it from home. It will enable students to build and organize their professional portfolio of work. Students will also be able to share their projects with you at home!
  • Email: info@jointheleague.org, and include your student’s name and their new GitHub username (you can send the password as well if you think they may forget it).

We are so excited to get started...can’t wait to see you!
